title-group.article-title: Perturbation Selection and Local Influence Analysis for Generalized Linear Mixed Models

abstract.p: Identification of influential cases is an important step in data analysis. However, arbitrarily perturbing a model may result in misleading inference about the influential cases. Hence, an important issue of local influence analysis is to select an appropriate perturbation vector. In this article, we develop a perturbation selection method and a second-order local influence measure to address this issue and conduct local influence analysis in generalized linear mixed models. Four perturbation schemes are considered. The proposed approach is illustrated by a simulation study and two real examples. Some technical details are given in three appendices contained in a supplemental material which is available online.
